When the Circle of Pearls is burning, you need to throw Marrow of Mercy in it. At least one party member needs to be nearby the hag at the moment to witness the dialogue

Or they could be worried about the child she ate - Vanra. Go wild.

DisguisedHag.synopsis: The majority of this dialogue only triggers if the player has the quest to find the missing child Vanra from her mother, Lora. This is secretly the hag who is disguised as the real Captain Grisly (who is locked downstairs with a hag mask on - we can potentially save her later, but it's difficult).In this dialogue, Captain Grisly (the hag) asks us to kill Lora, a woman who 'claims' her daughter has gone missing and has caused nothing but trouble for the good Captain.If we refuse, she immediately turns into the hag. If we agree to do it and kill Lora, the hag is delighted and transforms.

AD_Patron_08_Idle.synopsis: Patron idle AD, has state for post disguised redcaps attack

AD_Hag_CellarIdle.synopsis: Idle ADs for the hag wandering around the cellar and playing idle animations (no item interactions). Ethel is walking around with her hands on her belly, softtly singing/reciting a poem to Vanra in a horrifying mimicry of a doting pregnant mother.

AD_Patron_07_Idle_0.speaker: Slog
AD_Patron_07_Idle_0.text: Finally - some bloody peace and quiet.

AD_Patron_07_Idle_1.speaker: Slog
AD_Patron_07_Idle_1.text: Maybe I'll just have one more...

AD_Patron_07_Idle_2.speaker: Slog
AD_Patron_07_Idle_2.text: Captain? CAPTAIN GRISLY! Where is she?
AD_Patron_07_Idle_2.context: NodeContext: panicked and afraid of the redcaps he sees

AD_Patron_07_Idle_3.speaker: Slog
AD_Patron_07_Idle_3.text: Whole city has gone to pot - thank Umberlee for the 'Maid.

AD_Patron_11_Idle_0.speaker: Bruno Indomicus
AD_Patron_11_Idle_0.text: But first - a drink, I reckon. It's long overdue.

AD_Patron_11_Idle_1.speaker: Bruno Indomicus
AD_Patron_11_Idle_1.text: Them - them monsters were humans before. I saw it!
AD_Patron_11_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: shook - just after a fight with redcaps occured right in front of him

AD_Patron_11_Idle_2.speaker: Bruno Indomicus
AD_Patron_11_Idle_2.text: No more chopping veggies and getting a bollocking. It's sweet freedom for Bruno!

AD_Patron_11_Idle_3.speaker: Bruno Indomicus
AD_Patron_11_Idle_3.text: 'Do this, Bruno, do that.' Can't Bruno get a minute to just sit down?
AD_Patron_11_Idle_3.context: NodeContext: grumpy, angrily sorting kitchen supplies/chopping veg (will depend on behaviours_

AD_Patron_11_Idle_4.speaker: Bruno Indomicus
AD_Patron_11_Idle_4.text: Bloody Grisly - this is damned slavery.

AD_Patron_11_Idle_5.speaker: Bruno Indomicus
AD_Patron_11_Idle_5.text: Thank you, Captain Grisly - for up and croaking. Hah!

AD_Patron_11_Idle_6.speaker: Bruno Indomicus
AD_Patron_11_Idle_6.text: I swear, all this for a booze tab. It was only a couple hundred!

Patron_08_12.speaker: Nesha Leesha
Patron_08_12.text: With some places, one visit is enough. This is one of those places.

Patron_08_13.speaker: Player
Patron_08_13.text: You should make yourself scarce - there's a killer loose and you're a target.

Patron_08_0.speaker: Nesha Leesha
Patron_08_0.text: Hah! Come off it, mate - who would want me dead?

Patron_08_15.speaker: Player
Patron_08_15.text: Fair point - must have mistaken you for someone.

Patron_08_14.speaker: Nesha Leesha
Patron_08_14.text: Don't fret about it, mate. Got one of those faces, don't I?

Patron_08_4.speaker: Player
Patron_08_4.text: Please listen to me. Others have died already, you are in danger.

Patron_08_17.speaker: Nesha Leesha
Patron_08_17.text: Oh shit... You're serious. I can see it in your eyes. I've got to - shit, I've got a tab to settle. SHIT!
Patron_08_17.context: NodeContext: flustered, upset, just been warned a murderer is after you

Patron_08_3.speaker: Nesha Leesha
Patron_08_3.text: Look mate - lay off. It was a bit funny the first time, now it's just weird.

Patron_08_16.speaker: Nesha Leesha
Patron_08_16.text: My friend dared me to come here alone for a couple of mugs of ale. So here I am!

AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_1.speaker: Captain Grisly
AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_1.text: You dare challenge Grisly, Captain of the Blushing Mermaid?
AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_1.context: NodeContext: in her mind, she's on top of her ship, roaring at an invading pirate party (she's actually in the hag cellar)

AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_6.speaker: Mask of Servitude
AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_6.text: This is Auntie's special place. You can't be in her special place!

AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_3.speaker: Mask of Terror
AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_3.text: Let's kill it. Kill it and stuff it - for Auntie.

AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_2.speaker: Captain Grisly
AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_2.text: Come on, mateys - let's slit this land-lubber from head to heel!
AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_2.context: NodeContext: in her mind, she's on top of her ship, roaring at an invading pirate party (she's actually in the hag cellar)

AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_5.speaker: Captain Grisly

AD_MaskedVictims_Attack_5.context: NodeContext: in her mind, she's on top of her ship, roaring at an invading pirate party (she's actually in the hag cellar)

AD_MaskedVictim_03_Resist_0.speaker: Mask of Vengeance

AD_MaskedVictim_03_Resist_0.context: NodeContext: in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

AD_MaskedVictim_03_Resist_1.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
AD_MaskedVictim_03_Resist_1.context: NodeContext: in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

AD_MaskedVictim_03_Resist_2.speaker: Mask of Vengeance

AD_MaskedVictim_03_Resist_2.context: NodeContext: in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

AD_MaskedVictim_03_Resist_3.speaker: Mask of Vengeance

AD_MaskedVictim_03_Resist_3.context: NodeContext: terrified, in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

Hag_AfterDeal_1.speaker: Auntie Ethel
Hag_AfterDeal_1.text: Now, now, petal - you know you shouldn't be here. Vanra is still cooking in my tum-tum.

Hag_AfterDeal_6.speaker: Auntie Ethel
Hag_AfterDeal_6.text: Unless - you're reconsidering our deal? Surely not - don't you want me to fight by your side when this city turns to shit?

Hag_AfterDeal_7.speaker: Player
Hag_AfterDeal_7.text: I changed my mind - surrender Vanra. Now.

Hag_AfterDeal_5.speaker: Auntie Ethel
Hag_AfterDeal_5.text: For the love of all that is sacred. You can't save her, petal - so do the heroic thing.

Hag_AfterDeal_3.speaker: Auntie Ethel
Hag_AfterDeal_3.text: Good. Then you won't mind getting out of my damn house.

Hag_AfterDeal_4.speaker: Auntie Ethel
Hag_AfterDeal_4.text: Gods, why are all the heroes as thick as pig shit? If you kill me, Vanra dies too!

Hag_AfterDeal_0.speaker: Auntie Ethel
Hag_AfterDeal_0.text: But fine - you'll make a pretty trophy when you're stuffed and tarred.

DisguisedRedcap_03_0.speaker: Maggoty Jim
DisguisedRedcap_03_0.text: You giving me eyes? Too bad - this full mast is reserved for the captain.
DisguisedRedcap_03_0.context: NodeContext: clearly hammered, gesturing to himself like he's the most attractive thing on the planet (he's not) (also yes mast is his penis)

DisguisedRedcap_03_1.speaker: Maggoty Jim
DisguisedRedcap_03_1.text: Gotta stay sharp in case the captain calls on me. She likes a bitta 'pearl diving', a spot of 'keel-hauling', the 'ol 'argy bargy', if ya get me.
DisguisedRedcap_03_1.context: NodeContext: clearly hammered, and clearly in no position to be 'called on'

AD_Patron_03_Idle_0.speaker: Grimbus
AD_Patron_03_Idle_0.text: The smell from this ale - my eyes are watering.
AD_Patron_03_Idle_0.context: NodeContext: blinking, but trying to make the bets of it - he wants to be AUTHENTIC

AD_Patron_03_Idle_1.speaker: Grimbus
AD_Patron_03_Idle_1.text: Well, if this is good enough for a buccaneer, it's good enough for me!
AD_Patron_03_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: determined to drink like a real life pirate.

AD_Patron_03_Idle_2.speaker: Grimbus
AD_Patron_03_Idle_2.text: Did I hear screaming just there? Someone should, ah, check on that.
AD_Patron_03_Idle_2.context: NodeContext: hears yelling and screams inside from a redcap attack. Looking around, hoping anyone but him will go check.

AD_Patron_03_Idle_3.speaker: Grimbus
AD_Patron_03_Idle_3.text: Was that - Why is my beverage crunchy?
AD_Patron_03_Idle_3.context: NodeContext: A bit aghast but he also assumes the problem is him (it isn;t)

Patron_01_0.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_0.text: I'm in the middle of something, mate.

AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_4.speaker: Lora
AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_4.text: Everything is going to be all right - I promise.
AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_4.context: NodeContext: trying to reassure herself as much as vanra

AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_6.speaker: Vanra
AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_6.context: NodeContext: deadpan, but with a touch of affection - like the real vanra is trying to push through

AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_2.speaker: Lora
AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_2.text: That's - that's right. Mummy is here.

AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_7.speaker: Lora
AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_7.text: We could go for a walk - would you like that?
AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_7.context: NodeContext: gentle, like she's speaking to a frightened animal

AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_1.speaker: Lora
AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_1.text: It's all right, it's all right, Vanra! We'll stay right here.
AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_1.context: NodeContext: vanra panicked at the mention of going outside

AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_8.speaker: Lora
AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_8.context: NodeContext: gentle, like she's speaking to a frightened animal

AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_9.speaker: Lora

AD_Lora_Vanra_PostHag_9.context: NodeContext: gentle, like she's speaking to a frightened animal

VomitsOutVanra_Hag_1.speaker: Auntie Ethel
VomitsOutVanra_Hag_1.text: What did you - hurk. Stay down, Vanra  - URGH.
VomitsOutVanra_Hag_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gagging and wretching - trying to stop herself from puking. Hands over mouth at end of line.NodeContext: Gagging and wretching - trying to stop herself from puking. Hands over mouth at end of line.

VomitsOutVanra_Hag_3.speaker: Auntie Ethel
VomitsOutVanra_Hag_3.text: MAYRINA? She did this to - BLEUGH.
VomitsOutVanra_Hag_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over mouth at start of line. Vomits loudly and disgustingly (shot from behind). Hunched over heavily.NodeContext: Hands over mouth at start of line. Vomits loudly and disgustingly (shot from behind). Hunched over heavily.

VomitsOutVanra_Hag_7.speaker: Auntie Ethel
VomitsOutVanra_Hag_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over mouth at start of line. Vomits loudly and disgustingly (shot from behind). Hunched over heavily.NodeContext: Hands over mouth at start of line. Vomits loudly and disgustingly (shot from behind). Hunched over heavily.

VomitsOutVanra_Hag_8.speaker: Player
VomitsOutVanra_Hag_8.text: That's it - cough her up, hag.

VomitsOutVanra_Hag_0.speaker: Auntie Ethel
VomitsOutVanra_Hag_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over mouth at start of line. Vomits loudly and disgustingly (shot from behind). Hunched over heavily.NodeContext: Hands over mouth at start of line. Vomits loudly and disgustingly (shot from behind). Hunched over heavily.

VomitsOutVanra_Hag_6.speaker: Auntie Ethel
VomitsOutVanra_Hag_6.text: ARGH. YOU COST ME A FRESH YOUNG HAG! I'M GOING TO PAINT THE WALL WITH YOUR GUTS YOU LITTLE SHITSTAIN.

Patron_06_3.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_3.text: Great - another newcomer. The Elfsong Tavern is down the road, yeah?

Patron_06_6.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_6.text: Sooner Lord Gortash cleans this place up, the better.

Patron_06_9.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_9.text: Keep bloody wits about you in here. The Captain is trying to keep it hush, hush, but I heard a kid got nabbed.

Patron_06_17.speaker: Player
Patron_06_17.text: I know - the child is called Vanra, right?

Patron_06_11.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_11.text: Knew it! No wonder Captain Grisly shoots daggers at anyone who mentions it.

Patron_06_7.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_7.text: My guess is it's them squatters. Spotted a bunch of misfits sneaking into one of them boarded up houses. Animals.

Patron_06_12.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_12.text: Lord Gortash will find that kid and sort all this out - just you wait.

Patron_06_0.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_0.text: Whole damn city has gone to pot.

Patron_06_5.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_5.text: Some folks have started breaking into places, too. Spotted a bunch of misfits sneaking into one of them boarded up houses. Animals.

Patron_06_15.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_15.text: Lord Gortash will sort all this out - just you wait.

Patron_06_10.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_10.text: Dunno - just heard whispers. But this all kicked off when we started letting just anyone waltz into the city.

Patron_06_8.speaker: Player
Patron_06_8.text: If a child is in this dump, they deserve to be 'nabbed'.

Patron_06_2.speaker: Player
Patron_06_2.text: The child should have known better.

Patron_06_14.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_14.text: If that's how you feel then we've got nothing to talk about, mate.

Patron_06_18.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_18.text: The hells was that racket inside? Grisly knocking heads again, I bet.

Patron_06_19.speaker: Zena
Patron_06_19.text: Piss off and let me drink in peace.

AD_Patron_05_Idle_0.speaker: Placer Verryn
AD_Patron_05_Idle_0.text: But how could I ever choose? They're both... perfect.
AD_Patron_05_Idle_0.context: NodeContext: drunk,talking to himself. Trying to choose what to drink

AD_Patron_05_Idle_1.speaker: Placer Verryn
AD_Patron_05_Idle_1.text: Umberlee's tits, what were them beasties?

AD_Patron_05_Idle_2.speaker: Placer Verryn
AD_Patron_05_Idle_2.text: Red is so fresh, so exciting.

AD_Patron_05_Idle_3.speaker: Placer Verryn
AD_Patron_05_Idle_3.text: Blonde has always been there for me. Red, on the other hand...

SavingVanra_3.speaker: Narrator
SavingVanra_3.text: *Auntie Ethel lies unconscious - her stomach bulging from the child she ate.*

SavingVanra_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneels down over the hag, blood splattering on them as they cut open the hag's stomach. AD_Patron_02_Idle_0.speaker: Tud Whetstone
AD_Patron_02_Idle_0.text: You know what makes a mermaid blush, right?

AD_Patron_02_Idle_1.speaker: Tud Whetstone
AD_Patron_02_Idle_1.text: Almost drunk enough to sing! One more mug...

AD_Patron_02_Idle_2.speaker: Tud Whetstone
AD_Patron_02_Idle_2.text: This ale is worse than moose piss, but they're out of moose piss, so...

AD_Patron_02_Idle_3.speaker: Tud Whetstone
AD_Patron_02_Idle_3.text: That was brutal. I loves me a pirate, o' course, but pirate redcaps - no, thank you!

AD_Hag_MushroomKilled_0.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_MushroomKilled_0.text: Argh - those fungi are worth a thousand of you, you pissant!
AD_Hag_MushroomKilled_0.context: NodeContext: angry (player has destroyed one of the mushrooms that lets her regenerate)

AD_Hag_MushroomKilled_1.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_MushroomKilled_1.context: NodeContext: angry (player has destroyed one of the mushrooms that lets her regenerate)

AD_Hag_MushroomKilled_2.speaker: Auntie Ethel

AD_Hag_MushroomKilled_2.context: NodeContext: angry (player has destroyed one of the mushrooms that lets her regenerate)

AD_Combat_Redcaps_002_0.text: Such pretty skin-flaps! I WANT THEM.

AD_Combat_Redcaps_000_0.speaker: Two-Toes Rischer
AD_Combat_Redcaps_000_0.text: Gonna bleed you. Cut you. Make ALL THE HOLES!

AD_Hag_Resurrection_1.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_Resurrection_1.context: NodeContext: cackling, delighted as she's resurrected

AD_Hag_Resurrection_2.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_Resurrection_2.text: Are you thick?! Kill me as many times as you like - I'll just keep coming!
AD_Hag_Resurrection_2.context: NodeContext: furious (player has killed her multiple times at this point)

Patron_02_0.speaker: Tud Whetstone
Patron_02_0.text: Want to hear a hot one? The other day I met some folks who'd banded together to 'fight back'. Against what, you ask?

Patron_02_2.speaker: Tud Whetstone
Patron_02_2.text: Hags. How stupid can you get?

Patron_02_1.speaker: Tud Whetstone
Patron_02_1.text: Still here? You look more like the Elfsong type to me. You know, not drunk.

Patron_02_3.speaker: Tud Whetstone
Patron_02_3.text: This is the kind of place where you sit with your back to the wall, if you're smart. And I'm smart.

AD_MaskedVictim_01_Resist_0.speaker: Mask of Servitude
AD_MaskedVictim_01_Resist_0.context: NodeContext: in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

AD_MaskedVictim_01_Resist_2.context: NodeContext: in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

AD_MaskedVictim_01_Resist_3.context: NodeContext: in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

AD_Combat_Redcaps_Bloodlust_0.context: NodeContext: Starts off at a whisper and builds to a maniacal

PAD_WyllsMemory_0.speaker: Wyll
PAD_WyllsMemory_0.text: Ah - the Blushing Mermaid. I stole a few kisses or three here before my exile.

PAD_WyllsMemory_2.speaker: Player
PAD_WyllsMemory_2.text: |Only kisses? Are you sure about that?|

PAD_WyllsMemory_1.speaker: Wyll
PAD_WyllsMemory_1.text: Only kisses. But sweet as honey mead, every last one.

BosunGannet_5.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_5.text: Welcome back, mate. What can I get you?

BosunGannet_17.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_17.text: Bloody hells, that was some ruckus. I catch you fighting any more drunks, I'll toss ye all outside. Even if they did deserve a clatter.

BosunGannet_41.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_41.text: If yer here to complain' that the booze tastes like piss - I know. Anything else?

BosunGannet_61.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_61.text: I didn't fight drunks - I fought redcaps.

BosunGannet_18.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_18.text: A... redcap? One of 'em pointy looking fuckers? You know, I thought I saw - urgh.
BosunGannet_18.context: NodeContext: confused, dazed, trying to remember (then wince of pain at end and touches head) he's been put under a spell by the hag

BosunGannet_6.speaker: Narrator
BosunGannet_6.text: *Magic tickles your senses, the same you felt around the Flaming Fist in Basilisk Gate. Someone, or something, has tampered with his memory.*

BosunGannet_33.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_33.text: Sorry, mate, only red in here is my patrons' faces when they've had a few too many. Take it easy, yeah?
BosunGannet_33.context: NodeContext: snaps back, confusion gone - jovial smile

BosunGannet_9.speaker: Narrator
BosunGannet_9.text: *Magic tickles your senses. Someone, or something, has tampered with his memory.*

BosunGannet_55.speaker: Narrator
BosunGannet_55.text: *His eyes glaze over as the spell takes effect - his memory lost.*

BosunGannet_60.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_60.text: It's a sad day in the 'Maid. A sad and bloody day.

BosunGannet_12.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_12.text: Captain Grisly is dead. My only comfort is that you offed her killer - a godsdamned hag, of all things.
BosunGannet_12.context: NodeContext: sad, trying to be grateful but sturggling

BosunGannet_54.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_54.text: How'd she get captured in the first place?

BosunGannet_24.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_24.text: Not a clue - my head is still melted. Feels like I've been sucking on fog for days.

BosunGannet_36.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_36.text: All I know is I had one job - protect my Captain. And I failed.

BosunGannet_48.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_48.text: I'm sorry I couldn't save her.

BosunGannet_19.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_19.text: Don't be. You weren't the one who was supposed to protect her.

BosunGannet_29.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_29.text: I think I killed the real Captain - she was under the hag's control.

BosunGannet_15.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_15.text: Then I'm glad. The Captain didn't take orders from nothing or nobody. She'd have picked death over the hag any day.

BosunGannet_68.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_68.text: She left me the 'Maid. And while it won't be the same without her, know you're always welcome here, mate.
BosunGannet_68.context: NodeContext: heavy sigh, affection at the end

BosunGannet_43.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_43.text: Any trade available to a heroic hag-killer?

BosunGannet_66.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_66.text: No pissin' or shittin'. If ya break it, ya pay for it. Any fightin' and Captain Grisly will shank ya. Got it?
BosunGannet_66.context: NodeContext: the tone of a man who's dealt with many, many drunkards and is tired

BosunGannet_28.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_28.text: Is your captain all right? I saved her from the hag.

BosunGannet_23.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_23.text: Aye - and I didn't lift a finger to save her. It was like I was stuck in a fog, my mind addled from every direction.

BosunGannet_69.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_69.text: All I could hear was a voice telling me the Captain was safe and well upstairs. Gives me the willies just thinking about it.
BosunGannet_69.context: NodeContext: a slight smile at the threat - he knows it's the captains why of showing thanks

BosunGannet_13.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_13.text: Captain said you're one of us now. So, far as I'm concerned, you're part of the crew, mate. Welcome to the 'Maid.

BosunGannet_0.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_0.text: What is going on in your basement? There's masks, mushrooms - all the signs of a hag.

BosunGannet_25.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_25.text: If this is a joke, you're missing the punchline. Basement has four walls and some shelves, mate - was down there just this morning.

BosunGannet_30.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_30.text: But, uh, keep working on the comedy routine, yeah?

BosunGannet_58.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_58.text: Good. Welcome to the Blushing Mermaid.
BosunGannet_58.context: NodeContext: sigh, already done with the player

BosunGannet_49.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_49.text: I'm here about the missing girl - Vanra?

BosunGannet_27.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_27.text: Gods above - not again. You pull a knife on me like the last one, and you're getting the boot - you hear?

BosunGannet_22.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_22.text: Who pulled a knife on you?

BosunGannet_32.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_32.text: That woman 'Lara', or 'Lora', whatever her bloody name is. She was screaming her head off about some kid -  tore the place apart. Bloody disturbing.
BosunGannet_32.context: NodeContext: he's a tough man, but he's clearly shook up

BosunGannet_70.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_70.text: Captain Grisly had to clock her in the end - threw her out on her arse. Good riddance.

BosunGannet_7.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_7.text: Didn't think a tough guy like you would be scared of a little knife.

BosunGannet_63.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_63.text: I've killed people with a splinter, mate. 'Course I'm wary of a blade.

BosunGannet_37.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_37.text: 'Lara', or 'Lora', was her name. Started tearing the place apart, screaming about some kid. Bloody disturbing it was.
BosunGannet_37.context: NodeContext: he's a tough man, but he's clearly shook up

BosunGannet_14.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_14.text: I'd love to see you try and kick me out.

BosunGannet_53.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_53.text: Won't be no need so long as you don't try to shank me, or start screaming about vanishing children.

BosunGannet_59.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_59.text: 'Lara' or 'Lora' or whatever it was learned that lesson the hard way.

BosunGannet_71.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_71.text: What if I really really need to use the latrine?

BosunGannet_8.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_8.text: Then piss in your cup - like the rest of us.
BosunGannet_8.context: NodeContext: saying it like it's painfully obvious

BosunGannet_50.speaker: Player
BosunGannet_50.text: You need to leave - Captain Grisly is a hag.

BosunGannet_62.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_62.text: You saw her change too?! I tried to gut her but she - she dug her claws in me and - urgh.

BosunGannet_38.speaker: Bosun Gannet
BosunGannet_38.text: Ah here, mate - I know the Captain is a bit of a battleaxe, but a 'hag'? Yer out of line.

AD_GreetingAuntieEthel_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
AD_GreetingAuntieEthel_1.text: Unless the 'Maid is on fire, shove off.

AD_GreetingAuntieEthel_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
AD_GreetingAuntieEthel_0.text: Actually, just leave me to burn - bloody hangover.
AD_GreetingAuntieEthel_0.context: NodeContext: hungover, annoyed at her stomach

AD_Patron_06_Idle_0.speaker: Zena

AD_Patron_06_Idle_1.speaker: Zena
AD_Patron_06_Idle_1.text: I swear, I don't see a single Baldurian here anymore...

AD_Patron_06_Idle_2.speaker: Zena
AD_Patron_06_Idle_2.text: Can't people just bugger off and leave us be?

AD_Patron_06_Idle_3.speaker: Zena
AD_Patron_06_Idle_3.text: This used to be such a beautiful city.

AD_Vanra_HomeAlone_2.speaker: Vanra
AD_Vanra_HomeAlone_2.context: NodeContext: calling out for her mother

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_3.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_3.text: I have a date to get to - finish your bloody drink.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_19.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_19.text: I will finish it in my own damn time - thank you very much.
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_19.context: NodeContext: doesn't want him to go, grumpy

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_24.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_24.text: We need to tell the captain about this - he's old friends with Grisly.
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_24.context: NodeContext: worried, she's just seen/heard a fight with recaps

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_40.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_40.text: We'll get the word out, but this ain't our problem. Nor yours, mate. Suggest you scarper while the going is good.
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_40.context: NodeContext: first sentence said to siggy, next two said to player.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_51.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_51.text: You're going on a date? Are you joking? The city is a hair's breadth from violence, and we're shipping off at first light!

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_48.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_48.text: So? I'll be back by then.
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_48.context: NodeContext: shrug, really doesn't see the fuss his friend is making

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_44.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_44.text: Mate, you'd be late to your own funeral. Look, skip the date, and I'll take you out next time we port, all right?
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_44.context: NodeContext: frustrated, scared for her friend. Tryying to keep it light at the end.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_53.speaker: Narrator
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_53.text: *Her eyes shine with concern and love - that of more than a friend.*

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_29.speaker: Player
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_29.text: The armies of the Absolute could attack at any moment, and you're worried about a date?

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_8.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_8.text: Mate, we once docked at Moonshae while a fomorian chucked rocks at us - yet here I stand, not a bother on me!
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_8.context: NodeContext: rolling his eyes, laughing it off

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_6.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_6.text: You lot worry too much. Now, let's finish our drinks, yeah? I don't want to be late.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_45.speaker: Player
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_45.text: This woman clearly loves and worries about you. You should listen to her.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_17.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_17.text: Love? Ah, well, I wouldn't go that far but... yeah. I'm worried about you, mate. Ship wouldn't be the same without you.
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_17.context: NodeContext: loves her friend dearly but is trying to be cool about it, kind of awkward but very adorable

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_36.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_36.text: Oh, come on - you know I'm a sucker for that soppy shit.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_38.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_38.text: Fine - no date. But let's say we grab another one here for the road - my treat?

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_16.speaker: Player
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_16.text: She's right - you should leave the city while you have the chance.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_9.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_9.text: See? The slightly creepy eavesdropper agrees with me.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_14.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_14.text: I'll sweeten the deal - come back tonight, and I'll give you the good hammock.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_47.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_47.text: Bloody hells, you're like a stray with a bone. Fine - but only because it's you asking.
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_47.context: NodeContext: acting more annoyed then he is, big smile at the end. Love his friend

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_13.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_13.text: Did I ask you, mate? No. And neither you nor mother hen here are going to stop me from having a good time.
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_13.context: NodeContext: slightly annoyed, more confused why everyone is making such a big deal out of this

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_10.speaker: Svend

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_10.context: NodeContext: slightly annoyed, more confused why this is all such a big deal

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_35.speaker: Player
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_35.text: This woman is offering to buy you drinks - for free. Skip the date!

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_21.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_21.text: Wait - I never said for free.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_26.speaker: Siggy
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_26.text: Damn it, fine. But just this one time.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_5.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_5.text: Did I ask you, mate? No. And neither you nor mother hen here are going to stop me from the simple pleasure of a date.
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_5.context: NodeContext: slightly annoyed, more confused why everyone is making such a big deal out of this

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_11.speaker: Player
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_11.text: What's life without a little danger? Go on your date - have fun.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_27.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_27.text: See? The dashing stranger agrees with me. And if that isn't a sign, I don't know what is.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_46.speaker: Player
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_46.text: Brief, fleeting relationships are simply ripples in the pond. Forego your date - your friend is more important.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_7.speaker: Player
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_7.text: Leave the angst for the romance novels. This woman loves you - skip the date.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_12.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_12.text: You worry too much, hen. Now, let's finish our drinks, yeah? I don't want to be late.
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_12.context: NodeContext: rolling his eyes, laughing it off

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_55.speaker: Svend
Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_55.text: So, where are you taking me out at next port? I'm thinking... expensive.

Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_34.speaker: Siggy

AD_MissingKidsMother_Worried_0.text: Vanra, please be all right. I'll do anything, so long as you're all right.

AD_MissingKidsMother_Worried_1.speaker: Lora
AD_MissingKidsMother_Worried_1.text: Gods above, what is taking so long?

AD_MissingKidsMother_Worried_2.speaker: Lora
AD_MissingKidsMother_Worried_2.text: Surely I should have heard something about Vanra by now...

AD_MaskedQuenora_IdleDigging_0.speaker: Captain Grisly
AD_MaskedQuenora_IdleDigging_0.text: X marks the spot... gonna dig the lot...
AD_MaskedQuenora_IdleDigging_0.context: NodeContext: creepy and quietly muttering to herself

AD_MaskedQuenora_IdleDigging_1.speaker: Captain Grisly
AD_MaskedQuenora_IdleDigging_1.context: NodeContext: creepy and quietly muttering to herself

AD_MaskedQuenora_IdleDigging_2.speaker: Captain Grisly
AD_MaskedQuenora_IdleDigging_2.context: NodeContext: creepy and quietly muttering to herself

Vanra_AtHome_0.speaker: Vanra
Vanra_AtHome_0.text: Mummy says I shouldn't talk to strangers.

Vanra_AtHome_2.speaker: Vanra
Vanra_AtHome_2.context: NodeContext: simply stares vacantly at the player

Vanra_AtHome_3.speaker: Vanra
Vanra_AtHome_3.text: You look weird - I bet you're weird.

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_0.speaker: Svend
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_0.text: You know there might be room in the hammock tonight for two?

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_11.speaker: Siggy
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_11.text: I'm sure the cook would be happy to share with you - so long as you like the smell of ham.

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_1.speaker: Svend
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_1.text: Are you sure you don't want another drink?

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_2.speaker: Siggy
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_2.text: Just be sure you're back before dawn.

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_5.speaker: Svend
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_5.context: NodeContext: rolling his eyes, shrugging it off

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_6.speaker: Siggy
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_6.text: You know the captain won't wait for you, right?

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_4.speaker: Svend
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_4.text: Yes, I have sailed with him before. Many times.
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_4.context: NodeContext: rolling his eyes, shrugging it off

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_7.speaker: Svend
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_7.context: NodeContext: scared - redcaps have appeared, worried for his friend

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_10.speaker: Svend
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_10.text: Yeah. Bloody hells, what kind of ship is Grisly running?

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_14.speaker: Siggy
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_14.text: So do you every time you speak. Now finish your drink.

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_15.speaker: Svend
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_15.context: NodeContext: jovial, trying to cheer her up

AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_8.speaker: Svend
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_8.text: Yes you are - that's your worried face.
AD_Patron_01_Patron_09_Debate_8.context: NodeContext: jovial, trying to cheer her up

Patron_13_0.speaker: Nafula
Patron_13_0.context: NodeContext: Terrified, looking for her dad

Patron_13_1.speaker: Nafula
Patron_13_1.text: I'm here to meet my dad. Wish me luck... and booze. Lots of booze.

Patron_13_2.speaker: Nafula
Patron_13_2.text: Where is the bosun with my drink?

Patron_13_3.speaker: Nafula
Patron_13_3.text: Thank you. Here's to starting a new life - one of our own choosing.

AD_Patron_10_Idle_0.speaker: Tongs Stoneheart
AD_Patron_10_Idle_0.text: Hey, who knows a good drinking song?

AD_Patron_10_Idle_1.speaker: Tongs Stoneheart
AD_Patron_10_Idle_1.text: Whoa, did you see those redcaps? That was wild!

AD_Patron_10_Idle_2.speaker: Tongs Stoneheart
AD_Patron_10_Idle_2.text: I'm gonna catch me a hot one tonight!

AD_Patron_10_Idle_3.speaker: Tongs Stoneheart
AD_Patron_10_Idle_3.text: Look out, lads and lasses, Tongs is starting to feel amorous.

Patron_05_0.speaker: Placer Verryn
Patron_05_0.text: If you had to choose the red one or the blonde one, which should I - which would you choose?

Patron_05_8.speaker: Placer Verryn
Patron_05_8.text: Shhh. Red one or blonde one?

Patron_05_2.speaker: Placer Verryn
Patron_05_2.context: NodeContext: kinda drunk, wonder in his voice

Patron_05_3.speaker: Placer Verryn
Patron_05_3.text: I - I need a drink. Bloody hells.
Patron_05_3.context: NodeContext: just saw a massive and terrifying fight between player and monsters

Patron_05_7.speaker: Placer Verryn
Patron_05_7.text: Blonde lager - the old reliable. She doesn't need to pretend - she knows who she is.

Patron_05_12.speaker: Placer Verryn
Patron_05_12.text: Beautiful red ale - the taste, the feel. How could I have doubted her?

AD_MotherSeesSavedChild_3.speaker: Lora
AD_MotherSeesSavedChild_3.context: NodeContext: sees her daughter for the first time since she vanished. Shock, doesn't believe her eyes, then tears - crying out in joy.

AD_MotherSeesSavedChild_0.speaker: Lora
AD_MotherSeesSavedChild_0.text: I've got you, my sweet girl. Mummy is here.
AD_MotherSeesSavedChild_0.context: NodeContext: crying, relieved, never wants to let Vanra out of her sight

VanraSaved_3.speaker: Vanra

VanraSaved_7.speaker: Player

VanraSaved_5.speaker: Vanra
VanraSaved_5.context: NodeContext: traumatised, struggling to speak - trying to say 'mummy'

VanraSaved_2.speaker: Vanra

VanraSaved_0.speaker: Vanra

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_1.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_1.text: Have you found her? My daughter?

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_16.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_16.text: You're here! Does this mean you found my daughter? The Flaming Fist still have no clue. Useless twats.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_38.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_38.text: You never told me you pulled out a knife in the Blushing Mermaid. Or that you used to be a pirate.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_21.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_21.text: I'm not proud of my past, all right? I lived a violent life. But that all changed when I had Vanra.
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_21.context: NodeContext: little taken aback at the beginning, player has called her out on her past - rushing to smooth things over

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_52.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_52.text: Getting the occasional drink in the Blushing Mermaid is as close as I get to the old days.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_12.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_12.text: As for pulling a knife... fine - I did. But! They wouldn't let me look for Vanra and I panicked. All right?

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_58.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_58.text: Captain Grisly said you don't have a daughter.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_3.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_3.text: How could she say such an awful thing?

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_57.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_57.text: I - I feel like I'm losing my mind. Vanra is real, damn it. All I want is for her to be home and safe - please.
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_57.context: NodeContext: shocked and upset, breaking down a little

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_72.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_72.text: I'd bet my last copper that Captain Grisly has something to do with this. Why else would she try to turn you against me?

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_48.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_48.text: You have to find her, you have to get Vanra back. Please, I'm begging you.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_33.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_33.text: What else have you lied about?

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_25.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_25.text: Nothing - I swear on every god in the realms. I just want to find my daughter!

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_28.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_28.text: Why does this keep happening? Why is no one listening to me?
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_28.context: NodeContext: upset, breaking down a little

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_67.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_67.text: I'm actually here to kill you. Grisly made me an offer I can't refuse.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_2.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_2.text: What? If this is a joke, it's not funny. Why would Grisly want me dead?

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_4.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_4.text: Oh, gods above - you're serious. HELP! HELP!
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_4.context: NodeContext: realise the player is about to kill her, panicked,

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_54.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_54.text: A hag took her - I saw it with my own eyes.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_70.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_70.text: A hag has her? Gods above.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_40.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_40.text: What does a hag want with Vanra? My poor child...

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_56.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_56.text: You have to do something - you have to save her. I have no one else. Please, help my little girl. Please.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_11.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_11.text: No. She can't be dead... she can't be...
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_11.context: NodeContext: just learned vanra is dead. that disbelief when your world is falling apart

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_34.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_34.context: InternalNodeContext: Runs awayNodeContext: screaming with grief

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_0.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_0.text: Please, don't give up on her.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_17.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_17.text: You brought her back - you brought back my sweet sweet girl.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_18.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_18.text: The hag was my problem to deal with.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_63.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_63.text: It was everything. I'll never forget it.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_37.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_37.text: Keep a closer eye on her in future.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_20.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_20.text: I doubt I'll ever sleep again, for fear she'll be swiped from under my nose.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_6.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_6.text: You're damn lucky I was here - she almost died.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_13.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_13.text: And I will die, hopefully many years from now, with your name on my lips - forever grateful for what you've done for us.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_14.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_14.text: Here - a token from the pirate life I left behind. Thank you - for being braver than half this city put together.
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving Vanra

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_47.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_47.text: I wanted to thank you properly - had something to give you - but I've been robbed.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_31.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_31.text: Hard to care about losing anything now I've got the one thing that matters back though.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_23.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_23.text: You're really not big on social graces, are you? I can tell.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_26.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_26.text: I'll be keeping a close eye on Vanra from now on - don't you worry.
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_26.context: NodeContext: sad smile - she knows it's too late

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_51.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_51.text: Unless you have news of my daughter, I don't want to hear it.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_59.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_59.text: Tell me that hag didn't hurt my baby - please.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_29.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_29.text: I'm working on a way to save her - don't worry.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_35.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_35.text: When you walked in,  I was prepared for the worst. This waiting is driving me insane.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_22.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_22.text: But waiting's all I can do. Please - find her.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_64.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_64.text: Can you say anything else, Vanra? Anything but 'Mummy'?
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_64.context: NodeContext: vanra has returned, safe and sound, but can't say anything other than 'Mummy'. Speaking to vanra, gentle and soft - like she's speaking to a frightened animal) - maybe bening down a bit?

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_19.speaker: Vanra
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_19.context: NodeContext: catatonic, staring dead ahead, repeats Mummy deadpan

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_15.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_15.text: I'm so sorry, my sweet girl. I'm so sorry I couldn't protect you.
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_15.context: NodeContext: trying not to cry, feels like she's failed as a mother (bending down a bit maybe? same as previous line)

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_32.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_32.text: No. Just 'Mummy' - over and over again.
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_32.context: NodeContext: speaking to player, sad shake of her head

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_43.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_43.text: I've come to collect my reward for saving your kid.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_41.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_41.context: NodeContext: speaking t player, shake as she brushed off her unshed tears

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_30.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_30.text: Yes it is. I'm her mother - I'm supposed to keep her safe.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_42.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_42.text: I'll fix her. I don't care if I have to trek to the Moonshae Isles and back to find a cure.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_53.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_53.text: Here - a token from the pirate life I left behind.
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving VanraNodeContext: generic handing gesture, small sad smile

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_39.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_39.text: Thank you, for bringing Vanra back to me. We're gonna get help for you, sweet girl, all right?
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_39.context: NodeContext: first line for player, second to vanra - that genlt voice, like she's a frightened animal

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_7.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_7.text: Oh no. I'm sorry, I had something for you - a paltry token, but it's gone. I'm ashamed that I have nothing but thanks to give you.
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_7.context: NodeContext: patting pockets (she's been pickpoketed) embarassed

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_73.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_73.text: Do you make a point of walking into strangers houses?
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_73.context: NodeContext: player has essentially just walking into her house, bemused

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_71.speaker: Vanra
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_71.text: I don't like them, mummy. They look weird.
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_71.context: NodeContext: loudly and boldly, like the player isn't staring directly in front of her.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_36.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_36.text: You heard her. I'm sure you can find the door.

MissingKidsMother_AtHome_50.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_AtHome_50.text: Go on. I'm sure you can find the door.

DisguisedRedcap_04_0.speaker: Blunder Bob
DisguisedRedcap_04_0.text: WHERE'S ME CLAP OF THUNDER, BOYS?
DisguisedRedcap_04_0.context: NodeContext: hammered, calling for another drink

DisguisedRedcap_04_1.speaker: Blunder Bob
DisguisedRedcap_04_1.context: NodeContext: Drunk, considering where he should have another. Absolutely decides to have another.

MaskedVictim_03_0.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim_03_0.text: The baby - do you hear the baby crying? Oh, never mind. Auntie got it.
MaskedVictim_03_0.context: NodeContext: dreamy, creepy out of it -

MaskedVictim_03_1.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim_03_1.text: Make Auntie give him back! Make her give me back my baby.
MaskedVictim_03_1.context: NodeContext: this should be freaky as hell - panicked, frantic, emotional

MaskedVictim_03_2.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim_03_2.text: Auntie says I can see the baby when it's time. But I have to be good.

MaskedVictim_03_3.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim_03_3.text: Auntie has my baby! Where is he? Where is my baby?!
MaskedVictim_03_3.context: NodeContext: this should be freaky as hell - panicked, frantic, emotional

MaskedVictim_01_2.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim_01_2.text: Look at me. I used to be ugly, but Auntie made me perfect - she made me beautiful.
MaskedVictim_01_2.context: NodeContext: dreamy and out of it (under the hag's control)

MaskedVictim_01_3.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim_01_3.text: Everyone wants to marry me now. It's wonderful.
MaskedVictim_01_3.context: NodeContext: dreamy and out of it (under the hag's control)

AD_QuenoraGrizly_FailResist_0.speaker: Captain Grisly
AD_QuenoraGrizly_FailResist_0.text: I'll shank the bastards, Auntie - I swear it!

DisguisedHag_12.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_12.context: NodeContext: hungover out of her tree

DisguisedHag_30.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_30.text: You! A little birdie told me that you killed that annoying redhead - Lora was her name. Is that true?
DisguisedHag_30.context: NodeContext: delight and shock (player has done this without being asked)

DisguisedHag_15.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_15.text: HAH! I can't believe it. You took care of that pain in my arse without me ASKING?
DisguisedHag_15.context: NodeContext: shocked and DELIGHTED. Almost hooting with joy

DisguisedHag_100.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_100.text: Oh my goodness, that's a yes! HAH! I can't believe it. You took care of that pain in my arse without me asking?
DisguisedHag_100.context: NodeContext: shocked and DELIGHTED. Almost hooting with joy

DisguisedHag_83.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_83.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

DisguisedHag_33.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_33.text: So, will you bring me Lora's head? Or do I have to sleep with one eye open tonight? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
DisguisedHag_33.context: NodeContext: grumpy, annoyed that player hasn't done it yet

DisguisedHag_55.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_55.context: NodeContext: hungover out of her tree

DisguisedHag_47.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_47.text: You're the owner of this place, right? What is going on in your basement?

DisguisedHag_24.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_24.text: You got into my basement? Well, aren't you the shittiest little spoilsport?
DisguisedHag_24.context: NodeContext: annoyed, her big surprise (that she's a hag) has been ruined

DisguisedHag_75.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_75.text: I see signs of a hag downstairs. Explain yourself.

DisguisedHag_40.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_40.text: Aw, you ruined my big surprise!
DisguisedHag_40.context: NodeContext: over the top dissappointed - player has discovered she's connected to a hag.

DisguisedHag_78.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_78.text: Can't a captain be bloody hungover in peace? Oh - why, hello there.
DisguisedHag_78.context:
NodeContext: head in hand(s), grumpy - then looks up and sees player - instantly attracted to them
Question in rhetorical tone.

DisguisedHag_38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_38.text: Captain Grisly at your service. What can I do for a long drink of water like yourself?

DisguisedHag_14.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_14.text: I found this note. Who is 'Auntie'?

DisguisedHag_23.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_23.text: I've been in your basement - why does it look like the lair of a hag?

DisguisedHag_93.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_93.text: You what? Well, aren't the shittiest little spoilsport?
DisguisedHag_93.context: NodeContext: rolling eyes, player has ruined her charade, a little sulky

DisguisedHag_53.speaker: Captain Grisly
DisguisedHag_53.text: Guess there's no point in wearing this old thing anymore.
DisguisedHag_53.context: NodeContext: gesturing to herself, wry grin - she's about shed her illusion and trasnform into a hag. Excited, dramatic.

DisguisedHag_88.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_88.text: I'm here about a missing girl - Vanra.

DisguisedHag_108.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_108.context: NodeContext: throws eyes to heaven, annoyed

DisguisedHag_17.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_17.text: Listen, Lora was here, all right - knocking back pints like there's no tomorrow. But she was alone. I saw head nor arse of this so-called 'kid'.

DisguisedHag_43.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_43.text: And when we tried to kick her out? She pulled a knife on my front man. Bet she didn't tell you that bit, huh?

DisguisedHag_114.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_114.text: That's 'cause she's taking you for a ride - and not the fun kind.
DisguisedHag_114.context: NodeContext: yes this is an innuendo

DisguisedHag_106.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_106.text: If Lora's daughter isn't here, where is she?

DisguisedHag_82.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_82.text: Not a notion! But not a soul has seen this so-called Vanra of hers - myself included.

DisguisedHag_9.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_9.text: How do I know you're not lying?

DisguisedHag_13.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_13.text: I run a bar. What use would I have with some little one running around, crying and shitting?
DisguisedHag_13.context: NodeContext: rolling her eyes like it's the most ridiculous suggestion (it's not, she secretly has vanra)

DisguisedHag_113.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_113.text: Look, I know Lora from my pirating days - she ran with Bart Blackdagger's crew. Heard they tossed her overboard when she gutted the bosun over a game of cards.

DisguisedHag_107.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_107.text: You look like you can handle yourself. Did a little knife cause that much trouble?

DisguisedHag_110.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_110.text: Mate, I've boarded ships with less. And so has Lora.
DisguisedHag_110.context: NodeContext: thinks the player is a bit stupid, trying to make a point

DisguisedHag_94.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_94.text: She ran with Bart Blackdagger's crew. Heard they tossed her overboard when she gutted the bosun over a game of cards.

DisguisedHag_102.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_102.text: Now, I'd no beef with her before this - all are welcome in the 'Maid. But threatening my staff? Claiming we took her 'kid'? She's bonkers. Dangerous.

DisguisedHag_27.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_27.text: Next time she pulls a knife on me and mine, someone might die. Something has to be done.
DisguisedHag_27.context: NodeContext: wants the player to offer to kill lora. Very grim, concerned. Worried.

DisguisedHag_111.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_111.text: There's one way and one way only to shut someone up.

DisguisedHag_95.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_95.text: I'll talk to her - see if I can calm her down.

DisguisedHag_116.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_116.text: Life has taught me that chatter doesn't cut it.
DisguisedHag_116.context: NodeContext: deadly serious, a hint at her vicious nature

DisguisedHag_36.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_36.text: Just pay Lora off - that usually works.

DisguisedHag_61.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_61.text: Gold won't stop her stabbing me in my sleep over an imaginary kid.

DisguisedHag_35.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_35.text: A child is missing - I just want to get to the bottom of this.

DisguisedHag_19.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_19.text: Gods - do I have to spell it out for you? There is no child. Lora is mad as a box of frogs.

DisguisedHag_71.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_71.text: She's dangerous - and I couldn't call myself a captain if I stood by and did nothing.
DisguisedHag_71.context: NodeContext: trying to pitch it as there's no other choice, that Lora must be stopped - manipulating the player

DisguisedHag_70.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_70.text: Lora's child is missing - she pulled her knife in fear and anger. Have you not felt such things?

DisguisedHag_25.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_25.text: Punishment is in order - the girl must learn.

DisguisedHag_66.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_66.text: Oh, we're well past that I'm afraid. She's mad - dangerous. And I couldn't call myself Captain if I let it continue.
DisguisedHag_66.context: NodeContext: trying to pitch it as there's no other choice, that Lora must be stopped - manipulating the player

DisguisedHag_3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_3.text: I hate that it's come to this, but I'll pay a hoard of gold to whoever scuppers her. Permanently. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
DisguisedHag_3.context: NodeContext: should sound regretful. Trying to pitch it as there's no other choice, that Lora must be stopped - manipulating the player

DisguisedHag_10.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_10.text: No less insane than lying about having a kid! If you don't do it, I'll find someone else.

DisguisedHag_96.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_96.text: You can make it painless. Not everyone will.
DisguisedHag_96.context: NodeContext: trying to make the player see things her way, really being manipulative

DisguisedHag_85.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_85.text: Double that, and you've got a deal.

DisguisedHag_79.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_79.text: A tough negotiator - I like that. You've got yourself a deal.

DisguisedHag_58.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_58.text: Return when the deed is done.

DisguisedHag_81.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_81.text: Good. This is a mercy - I promise.

DisguisedHag_112.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_112.text: I need to think about it.

DisguisedHag_7.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_7.text: Don't take too long - or someone else might get there before you.

DisguisedHag_62.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_62.text: I refuse. I'll not harm an innocent.

DisguisedHag_4.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_4.text: Tch, paladins. Biggest bunch of dry-shites I ever laid eyes on.

DisguisedHag_22.speaker: Captain Grisly
DisguisedHag_22.text: Oh well! Guess I'll just decorate the room with your insides - they'll match my new carpet beautifully.
DisguisedHag_22.context: NodeContext: She's about shed her illusion and trasnform into a hag. Excited, dramatic. Vicious.

DisguisedHag_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Illusion drops - revealing Auntie Ethel

DisguisedHag_97.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_97.text: Absolutely not - I  refuse to do your dirty work.

DisguisedHag_90.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_90.text: Tch - you're no fun. I wanted you to stain your soul with the blood of an innocent mother.
DisguisedHag_90.context: NodeContext: we see the act drop, big smile from captain grisly

DisguisedHag_57.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_57.text: Killing Lora sounds like the best way.

DisguisedHag_117.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_117.text: You've had to get your hands dirty before, I see.

DisguisedHag_46.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_46.text: There's drinks aplenty at the bar. Anything else, well - those days are behind me - even for one as fine-looking as yourself.

DisguisedHag_80.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_80.text: Doesn't a captain need a ship?

DisguisedHag_67.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_67.text: You're standing in it, smart-arse. Or her innards, at least. She may not sit on water no more, but she'll always be my ship.
DisguisedHag_67.context: NodeContext: great pride in her old ship

DisguisedHag_37.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_37.text: I'm looking for work. Of the musical variety, preferably.

DisguisedHag_68.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_68.text: 'Fraid I've got that covered already, mate. They ain't tuneful, but they are cheap as piss.

DisguisedHag_105.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_105.text: Why don't you tell me why you're so heavily armed? I count no less than three hidden blades.

DisguisedHag_39.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_39.text: Sharp-eyed, aren't you? But you missed a few. I may not sail the seas anymore, but that doesn't mean I'm not ready for trouble. So, behave.
DisguisedHag_39.context: NodeContext: player has noticed she's heavily armed, smiled at 'you missed a few' (hinting that she's more daggers on her). 'Behave' is both a flirty invitation and a slight threat

DisguisedHag_87.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_87.text: Captain Grisly at your service. What can I do for a long drink of water like yourself?

DisguisedHag_101.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_101.text: Is it done? Has Lora stopped that wailing of hers - for good?

DisguisedHag_49.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_49.text: Wait - I have questions. Mainly about your basement - which looks like the lair of a hag.

DisguisedHag_64.speaker: Player
DisguisedHag_64.text: Of course she's dead - I'm a professional.

DisguisedHag_76.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_76.context: NodeContext: player actually killed lora and she is DELIGHTED. Touch of a maniacal laugh here, at odds with how Grisly has acted before this (in her next line, she uses the hag's real voice and then transforms)

DisguisedHag_31.speaker: Captain Grisly
DisguisedHag_31.context:
CinematicNodeContext: This node is spoken by a dummy character that is not in the room.

You will need to make sure that the usual speaker 1 is not visible when this speaker 3 is saying this line.

DisguisedHag_115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Illusion drops - revealing Auntie Ethel

DisguisedHag_77.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_BlushingMermaid_HagHumanForm
DisguisedHag_77.text: Quickly - or I'll find someone else to do it for me.

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_2.speaker: Madalitso
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_2.text: You mother and I had an arranged marriage, honey - it's not so bad.

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_0.speaker: Nafula
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_0.text: Wow - you're really selling it, dad.

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_4.speaker: Madalitso
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_4.text: Are you hurt, honey? Did they get you? Are you all right?
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_4.context: NodeContext: panicked, scared for his daughter (combat happened closed by - it's done now)

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_5.speaker: Nafula
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_5.text: I'm fine, dad - what about you?
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_5.context: NodeContext: dismissing herself, just worried about her dad

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_6.speaker: Madalitso
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_6.text: Don't mind me. Where in the hells is Grisly?!
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_6.context: NodeContext: rattled but trying to rally, transferring fear to anger in last line

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_9.speaker: Nafula
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_9.text: What about what I want? Does that not matter?

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_7.speaker: Madalitso
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_7.text: Choice is a luxury, honey. One your family cannot afford.

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_10.speaker: Madalitso
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_10.text: Honey, we're desperate. We need the Nielsens' money.
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_10.context: NodeContext: he hates having to beg

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_8.speaker: Nafula
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_8.text: I don't even know him, dad.

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_3.speaker: Madalitso
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_3.text: But you know me. Do you think I would choose a poor match for my daughter?

AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_1.speaker: Nafula
AD_Patron_12_Patron_13_GroupIdle_1.text: Dad, you're picking a husband for me, not a new dress!

PAD_HagCombatStart_0.speaker: Player
PAD_HagCombatStart_0.text: Careful - if the hag dies, the child does too.

PAD_HagCombatStart_1.speaker: Player
PAD_HagCombatStart_1.text: Time to kill the hag - permanently.

Patron_07_0.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_0.text: 'Duke' Gortash - bloody hells. Like that slimy prick gives a rat's arse about us.
Patron_07_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_07_1.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_1.text: You're not one of 'em goody-do-wells, are you? Urgh, read about it in Baldur's Mouth. Can't stand a lickarse.
Patron_07_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_07_2.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_2.text: If you're some big fan of 'Duke' Gortash, turn your arse around and walk - preferably straight into the harbour waters.
Patron_07_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_07_3.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_3.text: You picked the best spot in the city for a pint - blows the prissy 'Elfsong' out of the water, I can tell you that.
Patron_07_3.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the AbsoluteNodeContext: proud

Patron_07_4.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_4.text: Read about a bunch of pissants - and you fit the bill. All I can say is this - well bloody done. City is a shithole - cause as much trouble as you can, eh?
Patron_07_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation drop because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_07_5.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_5.text: Did you hear that scum-sucker Gortash bit the big one? Good, says I. Prick was too oily by half.

Patron_07_6.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_6.text: Folks be going on about the 'good of the city', blah, blah. Fuck that, I say. It's everyone for themselves - so take it all, mate.
Patron_07_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation drop because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_07_7.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_7.text: Yes, yes, butter wouldn't melt in your arsehole - so says the papers. I. Don't. Care.
Patron_07_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_07_8.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_8.text: The hells is the Captain? Why didn't she stop them freaks?
Patron_07_8.context: NodeContext: panicked after a red cap attack, looking around

Patron_07_9.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_9.text: Bet all the lords and ladies of Baldur's Gate are in a tizzy with their poster boy dead. Hope someone shits in their soup - hah.

Patron_07_10.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_10.text: Steel Watchers are dropping in the streets like flies! Bet the Flaming Fist are pissing themselves without their precious murder machines.

Patron_07_11.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_11.text: Maybe I'll rob the head of a broken Watcher - would make a nice trophy for my wall, don't you think?

Patron_07_12.speaker: Slog
Patron_07_12.text: You should see this place when the Captain's old crewmates pull up - it's a damn bloodbath. I love it.
Patron_07_12.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the AbsoluteNodeContext: fierce grin

Patron_10_0.speaker: Tongs Stoneheart
Patron_10_0.text: If I'm not swinging a hammer workin', I'm swinging a mug here drinkin'!

Patron_10_1.speaker: Tongs Stoneheart
Patron_10_1.text: These so-called pirates don't frighten me. I think they're adorable.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_7.speaker: Captain Grisly
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_7.text: I've raided warships. Fought every beastie the sea can throw at you, and I've never flinched - not once.
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_7.context: NodeContext: shook, vulnerable. This is the REAL captain grisly, who has been rescued from the hag by the player.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_3.speaker: Captain Grisly
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_3.text: But Ethel - Umberlee's tits, she snapped her fingers and had me. I would have died for her - wanted to.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_2.speaker: Captain Grisly
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_2.text: Then you showed up - armed to the teeth. You could have killed me - been right to. But you didn't. You have an old Captain's thanks.
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_2.context: NodeContext: getting a hold of herself. Grateful.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_5.speaker: Player
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_5.text: I've dealt with her before - I knew what to do.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_4.speaker: Captain Grisly
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_4.text: Knowing and doing are two different beasts. And one is a hell of a lot harder than the other.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_10.speaker: Captain Grisly
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_10.text: You're welcome in the 'Maid any time. The old girl is as much your home as she is mine - and I'll gut anyone who says otherwise.
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_10.context: NodeContext: grateful, a touch fierce at the end

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_1.speaker: Player
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_1.text: I was merely doing my duty.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_15.speaker: Captain Grisly
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_15.text: Oh, shut up. You saved me when you didn't have to - accept the damn 'thank you'.
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_15.context: NodeContext: the shut up' is because the player is being a bit magnanimous and humble, which grisly has ZERO time for.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_6.speaker: Player
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_6.text: Ethel was an abomination - it was my duty to hunt her down and kill her.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_8.speaker: Player
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_8.text: She crossed me once - I was sworn to end her.

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_14.speaker: Player
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_14.text: I owe you the thanks - that was a fight worthy of Gruumsh!

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_12.speaker: Captain Grisly
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_12.text: Yeah, well, Gruumsh didn't risk his neck to save me - you did.
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_12.context: NodeContext: grateful, a touch fierce because player tried to dodge her thanks

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_13.speaker: Captain Grisly
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_13.text: And you can call the 'Maid your own. The old girl is as much your home as she is mine - and I'll gut anyone who says otherwise.
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_13.context: NodeContext: grateful, a touch fierce at the end

Saved_QuenoraGrizly_9.speaker: Captain Grisly
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_9.text: I'm going to find a barrel of whiskey and drink it. Bloody hells.
Saved_QuenoraGrizly_9.context: NodeContext: shaken up, but recovering. She'll be back to her sassy self in no time.

Patron_04_0.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_0.text: I hope the Flaming Fist catch whoever hurt Duke Gortash. Who would hurt someone so - so wonderful?
Patron_04_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Players kill GortashNodeContext: upset

Patron_04_1.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_1.text: Did - did you hear the terrible news? Duke Gortash is dead! He was so young, and smart, and gorgeous. And I didn't even get to meet him!
Patron_04_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Players kill GortashNodeContext: upset

Patron_04_2.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_2.text: Are you a Captain Grisly fan too? I can't believe she's actually here. Or, rather, inside the Blushing Mermaid. I hope she signs my chapbook!
Patron_04_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the AbsoluteNodeContext: excited and nervous

Patron_04_3.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_3.text: It's so unfair. I tried to go to Duke Gortash's ceremony, but it was a 'closed event'. All I wanted was a peek at him - he's gorgeous.
Patron_04_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.NodeContext: having a whine with a touch of entitlement

Patron_04_4.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_4.text: I'm sorry, I don't know if anyone has told you, but you look just like one of those gorgeous adventurers in the papers! That's so funny.
Patron_04_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's MouthNodeContext: little bit star struck

Patron_04_5.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_5.text: I've been trying to summon the courage to ask for Captain Grisly. I'll get there... eventually.
Patron_04_5.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the AbsoluteNodeContext: shy, clearly a big fan of grisly

Patron_04_6.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_6.text: A Watcher collapsed right in front of me! What is going on?  I thought they were supposed to be, you know - unbreakable or something.

Patron_04_7.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_7.text: I hope they make some commemorative stuff for Duke Gortash's big day - maybe a chapbook or a poster. I'll buy them all!
Patron_04_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.NodeContext: excited

Patron_04_8.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_8.text: Have you seen the latest issue of Baldur's Mouth? Why are some people so awful?  I just can't believe it.
Patron_04_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation drop because an article at Baldur's MouthNodeContext: dramatic outrage

Patron_04_9.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_9.text: Someone should really do something about these defective Steel Watchers.
Patron_04_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Steel Watchers disabledNodeContext: she's not volunteering to help any time soon

Patron_04_10.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_10.text: My mother says I shouldn't read Baldur's Mouth, but it's the only paper out there telling us the truth!
Patron_04_10.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation drop because an article at Baldur's MouthNodeContext: the perosn who gets all their news from facebook

Patron_04_11.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_11.text: I'm tempted to ask you to sign my copy of Baldur's Mouth. But you're hardly the same adventurer. No one like that would hang out here.
Patron_04_11.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's MouthNodeContext: little bit star struck

Patron_04_12.speaker: Merri Fairweather
Patron_04_12.text: I heard screaming inside! I hope everyone's all right. You should, uh, you should go check.
Patron_04_12.context: NodeContext: concerned but not enough to actually do anything to help

DisguisedRedcap_01_0.speaker: Two-Toes Rischer
DisguisedRedcap_01_0.text: Ain't no better Grisly than Captain - I mean Captain than Grisly!

DisguisedRedcap_06_0.speaker: Silas Silvertongue
DisguisedRedcap_06_0.text: If we were at sea, the Bitch Queen would drown us for that travesty of a shanty. And she'd be right.

DisguisedRedcap_06_1.speaker: Silas Silvertongue
DisguisedRedcap_06_1.text: If you're here for the music, look elsewhere. It's like listening to a cat being flogged up here.
DisguisedRedcap_06_1.context: NodeContext: bemused laugh - his crew mates are trying to sing

AD_Patron_04_Idle_0.speaker: Merri Fairweather
AD_Patron_04_Idle_0.text: I need to pick up the new Baldur's Mouth - I hope it's about Gortash.

AD_Patron_04_Idle_1.speaker: Merri Fairweather
AD_Patron_04_Idle_1.text: Just go inside, Merri - what are you waiting for?
AD_Patron_04_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: trying to psych herself up

AD_Patron_04_Idle_2.speaker: Merri Fairweather
AD_Patron_04_Idle_2.text: Poor Captain Grisly... Now she'll never sign my chapbook.
AD_Patron_04_Idle_2.context: NodeContext: just thinking about how the captain's death efefcts her

AD_Patron_04_Idle_3.speaker: Merri Fairweather
AD_Patron_04_Idle_3.text: Why are people being so loud inside? Some of us are trying to relax.
AD_Patron_04_Idle_3.context: NodeContext: people are actually being attacked, but she just assumes it's there to inconvenience her

AD_Patron_04_Idle_4.speaker: Merri Fairweather
AD_Patron_04_Idle_4.text: I hope Captain Grisly signs my chapbook... or maybe she'll think I'm strange.

PAD_CutOutKid_0.speaker: Player
PAD_CutOutKid_0.text: Now's my chance - I need to get Vanra out.

Patron_12_0.speaker: Madalitso
Patron_12_0.text: Oh, I don't need a drink. Thank you.
Patron_12_0.context: NodeContext: thinks player is a waiter

Patron_12_1.speaker: Madalitso
Patron_12_1.text: Out of my way - I need my daughter.

Patron_12_2.speaker: Madalitso
Patron_12_2.text: I said I don't need a drink. Goodness, do they teach staff nothing these days?
Patron_12_2.context: NodeContext: thinks player is a waiter

AD_MissingKidsMother_RunsAway_0.speaker: Lora
AD_MissingKidsMother_RunsAway_0.text: Vanra! My baby. My sweet girl.
AD_MissingKidsMother_RunsAway_0.context: NodeContext: just learned her daughter is dead, bawling her eyes out, running away

AD_Patron_08_Idle_0.speaker: Nesha Leesha
AD_Patron_08_Idle_0.text: This place certainly has an interesting... aroma to it.

AD_Patron_08_Idle_1.speaker: Nesha Leesha
AD_Patron_08_Idle_1.text: I may just get out of here alive.

AD_Patron_08_Idle_2.speaker: Nesha Leesha
AD_Patron_08_Idle_2.text: Dear gods, what were those evil gnome things?

AD_Patron_08_Idle_3.speaker: Nesha Leesha
AD_Patron_08_Idle_3.text: Just one more drink and I'll have beat that dare.

AD_Hag_CellarIdle_1.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_1.text:
Against soldiers, hunters,
even armies we'll stand,
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_1.context: NodeContext: a poem - can be sung or recited as she rubs her belly, a lullaby for vanra

AD_Hag_CellarIdle_0.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_0.text:
Let the bastards come,
for together? We'll be grand.
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_0.context: NodeContext: a poem - can be sung or recited as she rubs her belly, a lullaby for vanra

AD_Hag_CellarIdle_3.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_3.text:
You'll have my teeth,
my eyes, my claws,
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_3.context: NodeContext: a poem - can be sung or recited as she rubs her belly, a lullaby for vanra

AD_Hag_CellarIdle_2.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_2.text:
And kill we shall,
without rhyme or cause.
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_2.context: NodeContext: a poem - can be sung or recited as she rubs her belly, a lullaby for vanra

AD_Hag_CellarIdle_5.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_5.text:
Vanra, my sweet,
big and strong you will grow,
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_5.context: NodeContext: a poem - can be sung or recited as she rubs her belly, a lullaby for vanra

AD_Hag_CellarIdle_4.speaker: Auntie Ethel
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_4.text:
And across this land
such evil we'll sow.
AD_Hag_CellarIdle_4.context: NodeContext: a poem - can be sung or recited as she rubs her belly, a lullaby for vanra
